intro: Struthanthus johnstonii, commonly known as Johnston's struthanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, adapted to conserve water in its native habitat. Struthanthus johnstonii is part of the tribe Cephalephe tribe within the family Polygonaceae, known for its unique floral structures and ecological adaptations.
